amendment.description: Amendment provides for the establishment of a religious freedom internet site, expanded international broadcasting, publication of religious prisoner lists, training for foreign service officers and equal access to U.S. missions abroad; expands contract sanctity; and establishes a five member U.S. Commission on International Religious Persecution.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 1 in part 2 of House Report 105-534, to establish a five-member U.S. Commission on International Religious Persecutionwhich includes four members of Congress and the Director of the Office of International Religious Persecution to promote accountability regarding the implementation of sanctions and monitor the effectiveness of those sanctions.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Brady amendment (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.
